definitions.definition: not very good; of only average standard

examples.text: I thought the play was only mediocre.
They have replaced a great leader with a mediocre one.
The player was under some pressure after some mediocre performances.
The use of crampons can make the difference between a mediocre climber and a good one.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from French médiocre, from Latin mediocris ‘of middle height or degree’, literally ‘somewhat mountainous’, from medius ‘middle’ + ocris ‘rugged mountain’.
